pli-tv-bu-vb-sk2:2.1: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk2:4.1: The sub-chapter on evenly all around
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk2:5.1: 2. The second training rule on evenly all around
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk2:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk2:6.2: At that time the monks from the group of six wore their upper robes hanging down in front and behind. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk2:7.1: “‘I will wear the upper robe evenly all around,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk2:8.1: One should wear the upper robe evenly all around, making two corners even.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk2:8.2: If a monk, out of disrespect, wears the upper robe hanging down in front or behind, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk2:9.2: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk2:10.1: The second training rule is finished.
